1.text: Add a drop of food coloring to your slime and knead it in.

2.text: Use markers to draw on your slime and then knead in the color.

3.text: Mix 1 teaspoon (5 g) of color pigment into your slime.

4.text: Knead glitter into your slime for color and sparkle.

5.text: Combine equal parts water and white or clear school glue.

6.text: Add 1 to 2 drops of your desired food coloring or paint.

7.text: Stir the liquid coloring into the glue-water with a spoon until the color is even.

8.text: Add in 1⁄4 cup (59 mL) of liquid starch.

9.text: Knead the slime for 1 minute to finish it.

10.text: Store the slime in a sealed plastic container or zippered sandwich bag.

11.text: Mix equal amounts of glue and water in a bowl.

12.text: Find eyeshadow or pigment powder in your desired color.

13.text: Scrape 1 teaspoon (5 g) of the eyeshadow into the glue-water.

14.text: Stir the powder into the glue-water with a spoon until the color is even.

15.text: Pour in 1⁄4 cup (59 mL) of liquid starch.

16.text: Knead the slime until it firms up.

17.text: Keep the slime in a zippered sandwich bag or a sealed container.

18.text: Mix equal parts of glue and water in a bowl.

19.text: Remove the end cap from a thick washable marker.

21.text: Squeeze 1 to 2 drops of color into the glue.

22.text: Stir the color into the glue.

23.text: Add 1⁄4 cup (59 mL) of clear liquid starch into the glue-water.

24.text: Knead the slime for 1 minute to finish it.

25.text: Put the slime in a sealed container or zippered sandwich bag.
